edu.fgcu.secrel

Class Service.Handle

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.fgcu.secrel.Service.Handle
  • Enclosing class:
    Service

    public class Service.Handle
extends Object
    The Handle class is a link between callers of a Service and its executing thread. When a Service is executed, a unique Handle instance is passed to the caller that can be used to query the state of the execution, receive messages from the executing thread and wait for its completion.
    Author:
    lngibson

      Fields

      Signifies that the executing thread is preparing to start.
      static int WAITING
      Signifies that the executing thread is blocked or waiting.

    • Field Detail

      • IDLE

        public static final int IDLE
        Signifies that the executing thread has not yet started. Service implementations must not set the state to this value as this is handled automatically.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STARTING

        public static final int STARTING
        Signifies that the executing thread is preparing to start. Service implementations need not use this state and may start in the RUNNING state.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RUNNING

        public static final int RUNNING
        Signifies that the executing thread is running its main section.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • WAITING

        public static final int WAITING
        Signifies that the executing thread is blocked or waiting. Service implementations should set the state to WAITING before entering a synchronized block or explicitly waiting.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FINALIZING

        public static final int FINALIZING
        Signifies that the executing thread is ready to send results. Service implementations that return results must set the state to FINALIZING so that the caller will know to read the results.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COMPLETED

        public static final int COMPLETED
        Signifies that the executing thread has completed and that any results are now available. Service implementations must not set the state to this value as this is handled automatically.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • inputStream

        protected InputStream inputStream()
        Returns the input stream for use by the executing thread.
        Returns:
        the input stream

      • outputStream

        protected OutputStream outputStream()
        Returns the output stream for use by the executing thread.
        Returns:
        the output stream

      • result

        protected void result(InputStream result,
                      int size)
        Sets the result of the Service and the size in bytes of that result. If the size cannot be predetermined, a -1 must be passed for size. In this case, all result fetching methods other than streamResult will fail.
        Parameters:
        result - the result of the Service
        size - the size of the result in bytes or -1 if it cannot be determined

      • state

        protected void state(int newState)
        Alerts the owner of this Handle of the state of the Service.
        Parameters:
        newState - the state of the Service

      • byteResult

        public int byteResult()
               throws IOException
        The result of the Service's operation as a byte if applicable. If there is no result or if the result has a size greater than one byte, an IllegalStateChangeException will be thrown. If this method is called before the Service has ended, an IllegalStateException will be thrown. To wait for the Service to finish, use join().
        Returns:
        the result as a byte
        Throws:
        IOException - if reads from the result stream fail

      • bytesResult

        public byte[] bytesResult()
                   throws IOException
        The result of the Service's operation as a byte array. If there is no result, an IllegalStateChangeException will be thrown. If this method is called before the Service has ended, an IllegalStateException will be thrown. To wait for the Service to finish, use join().
        Returns:
        the result as a byte
        Throws:
        IOException - if reads from the result stream fail

      • connect

        public void connect(InputStream in,
                    OutputStream out)
        Initializes input and output stream using supplied streams. This is meant to be used not by the caller but by an middle man. For example, if user invoke service over a tcp connection, as the SecRel system does not provide this mechanism, another application would relay the request to the system. Then, that application would call this method to connect the input and output stream from the caller to the executing thread using this method.
        Parameters:
        in - the input stream to connect to
        out - the output stream to connect to

      • doubleResult

        public double doubleResult()
                    throws IOException
        The result of the Service's operation as a double if applicable. If there is no result or if the result has a size not equal to 8 bytes, an IllegalStateChangeException will be thrown. If this method is called before the Service has ended, an IllegalStateException will be thrown. To wait for the Service to finish, use join().
        Returns:
        the result as a double
        Throws:
        IOException - if reads from the result stream fail

      • floatResult

        public float floatResult()
                  throws IOException
        The result of the Service's operation as a float if applicable. If there is no result or if the result has a size not equal to 4 bytes, an IllegalStateChangeException will be thrown. If this method is called before the Service has ended, an IllegalStateException will be thrown. To wait for the Service to finish, use join().
        Returns:
        the result as a float
        Throws:
        IOException - if reads from the result stream fail

      • intResult

        public int intResult()
              throws IOException
        The result of the Service's operation as an int if applicable. If there is no result or if the result has a size not equal to 4 bytes, an IllegalStateChangeException will be thrown. If this method is called before the Service has ended, an IllegalStateException will be thrown. To wait for the Service to finish, use join().
        Returns:
        the result as an int
        Throws:
        IOException - if reads from the result stream fail

      • join

        public void join(long timeout)
        Waits for the Service to complete or timeout milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the number of milliseconds to wait or -1 to wait indefinitely

      • longResult

        public long longResult()
                throws IOException
        The result of the Service's operation as a long if applicable. If there is no result or if the result has a size not equal to 8 bytes, an IllegalStateChangeException will be thrown. If this method is called before the Service has ended, an IllegalStateException will be thrown. To wait for the Service to finish, use join().
        Returns:
        the result as a long
        Throws:
        IOException - if reads from the result stream fail

      • shortResult

        public short shortResult()
                  throws IOException
        The result of the Service's operation as a short if applicable. If there is no result or if the result has a size not equal to 2 bytes, an IllegalStateChangeException will be thrown. If this method is called before the Service has ended, an IllegalStateException will be thrown. To wait for the Service to finish, use join().
        Returns:
        the result as a short
        Throws:
        IOException - if reads from the result stream fail

      • state

        public int state()
        Queries the state of the Service.
        Returns:
        the state of the Service

      • stateChange

        public int stateChange(int targetState,
                       long timeout)
        Waits for the Service state to change or timeout milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        targetState - the state to wait for or -1 to wait for any new state
        timeout - the number of milliseconds to wait or -1 to wait indefinitely
        Returns:
        the new state of the Service if changed

      • streamResult

        public InputStream streamResult()
        The result of the Service's operation as an InputStream. If this method is called before the Service has ended, an IllegalStateException will be thrown. To wait for the Service to finish, use join().
        Returns:
        the result as an InputStream

      • stringResult

        public String stringResult()
                    throws IOException
        The result of the Service's operation as a String. If this method is called before the Service has ended, an IllegalStateException will be thrown. To wait for the Service to finish, use join().
        Returns:
        the result as a String
        Throws:
        IOException - if reads from the result stream fail
